Oregon, told the Washington Post that the timing of Gabrielle Giffords opening her eyes was a good sign and sees a positive prognosis for the Congresswoman. "It's very significant," told the Post. In someone like her, who in just a few days after injury is opening her eyes and following commands, it is a much better prognostic indicator of recovery. It's less meaningful when it happens three or six months later. Two of Gabrielle Giffords 's colleagues and friends, Senator Kirsten Gillibrand of New York and Representative Debbie Wasserman Schultz of Florida, were with the Congresswomen at the time when she first opened her eyes, and called the moment miraculous
